conclusion: To determine the maximum distance between Car A and Car B, analyze the v-t graph and calculate areas under the curves.
Identify instances when cars are side by side; known at t = 30 seconds.
Car A accelerates from 0 to 40 m/s from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds.
Calculate area under Car A's curve from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds: 200 meters.
Car A moves at constant speed of 40 m/s from t = 10 to t = 30 seconds.
Calculate area under Car A's curve from t = 10 to t = 30 seconds: 800 meters.
Total displacement for Car A from t = 0 to t = 30 seconds is 1000 meters.
Car B accelerates uniformly from 0 to 60 m/s from t = 0 to t = 30 seconds.
Calculate area under Car B's curve from t = 0 to t = 30 seconds: 900 meters.
Since cars are side by side at t = 30 seconds, Car B started 100 meters ahead of Car A.
Determine other instance when cars are side by side, denote as t = T.
For Car A, displacement from t = 0 to t = T is 200 + 40(T - 10).
For Car B, displacement from t = 0 to t = T is T^2.
Set displacements equal for t = T: 200 + 40(T - 10) = T^2.
Solve quadratic equation T^2 - 40T + 200 = 0.
Solutions are T = 30 and T = 20 - 10âˆš2.
Maximum distance occurs at t = 20 seconds.
For Car A, displacement from t = 0 to t = 20 is 600 meters.
For Car B, displacement from t = 0 to t = 20 is 400 meters.
Distance between cars at t = 20 seconds is 200 meters.
Maximum distance between Car A and Car B is 200 meters.
